Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2013 08:52AM pegasus68 wrote: Personally, I think waiting would drive me nuts... it took almost 3 weeks to get my repeat mammo and US scheduled, which I just had on Friday. They immediately scheduled biopsy for next week (Thursday), and even just the few days waiting have me stressed out. I am trying to stay positive but the uncertainty is hard. Hugs and positive thoughts to all!
Posts.Title: Biopsy before or after the holiday? birad 4b, scared naturegirl11 Nora5

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2019 09:18AM pegasus68 wrote: Good news today - benign!!! It is, indeed, more of the same-old, same-old ("proliferative fibrocystic changes"). I guess there may be a small question regarding 'concordance' and location, so we'll need to wait for the radiologist's final report to get the final all-clear. (During the biopsy, they told me there were two nearby clusters and tried to set it up so they could sample both at the same time, but neither the first nor second round of core samples showed any calcs in them so that angle missed both spots. They then removed the needle and repositioned it directly on one of the clusters - but round 3 samples showed only 1 or 2 calcs so they had to take a 4th set of samples. At that point, they didn't even try to go back for the other spot - I was pretty much D-O-N-E for anyway.) But at least what they got was totally benign, and hopefully got enough that we are done with this for now! Thank you all so much for your prayers and support! And now I get to have a fun weekend! Hope you all do the same!
Posts.Title: Small cluster microcalcifications sagelady GreenHarbor

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2019 09:16AM pegasus68 wrote: Yes sagelady, I do think it is a good omen! For both of us! Thanks for sharing. And I LOVE the dune buggy! :-)
Posts.Title: Small cluster microcalcifications sagelady GreenHarbor

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2019 11:55AM pegasus68 wrote: No news for me yet, although I'm really hoping to hear by tomorrow. Early next week I'm out of town with one of my kids for an academic competition, and between traveling and the scheduled activities it may be difficult for me to take "the call". At any rate, I'm hopeful it's benign - I've had several past biopsies show all kinds of benign fibrocystic stuff, and the radiologist did say it's possible the microcalcs she saw could just be caused by fibrocystic changes. Unfortunately, I've also had a prior biopsy with LCIS and have a strong family history which makes me high risk so I can't completely silence the nagging worry that the odds are going to catch up with me... Either way, I will think of you and pray for you as you move forward with your plan!
Posts.Title: Small cluster microcalcifications sagelady GreenHarbor

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2013 12:46PM pegasus68 wrote: Thank you ladies for your replies! Nancy and Suzy, so sorry to hear your biopsies were painful! My team was wonderful and I didn't feel a thing. I am actually much less anxious now that is over. Just trying to keep busy while I am waiting for results - since it's the Christmas season, there is a lot to distract me. :-) I am supposed to get the results on Tuesday and am hoping for the best. Suzytchr, fingers crossed your results come back B9 too!
Posts.Title: Two different biopsies? pegasus68 awb

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2013 01:40PM - edited Dec 18, 2013 01:43PM by pegasus68 Thanks, Ziggypop! So...got the biopsy pathology report back today.  Two lesions:  one a fibroadenoma, the other atypical lobular hyperplasia and lobular carcinoma in situ.  I'm thankful it is not cancer, but still not happy about the potential implications of the LCIS.  Supposed to chat more with my dr about what the plan is moving forward.  Think I'll check out the LCIS board..
Posts.Title: Two different biopsies? pegasus68 awb

Posts.Content: pegasus68 wrote: I'm new here... to give you my story: My annual screening mammogram showed two 'asymmetric densities' on my lower right breast not seen on last year's scan (but I'm dense - my breasts, that is! :-0 ). Called back for spot mammo and US on Friday, which led the radiologist to schedule me for biopsy this week. Today I found that I am having two biopsy procedures on the same day - one stereotactic for the density they couldn't see on US, and one US-guided for the mass they found on US (neither one is palpable). Is that normal? I am going to the mammogram center at an NCI-designated cancer center, so I am sure they know what they are doing but I am now more worried about the procedure(s) than before when I thought it was one-and-done. Has anyone else had this? Somehow it feels scarier than just one procedure, even though I guess it's not really any different than taking multiple samples from a single procedure. (Not to mention - not looking forward to getting multiple holes punched in me!) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Two different biopsies? pegasus68 awb

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2019 07:44AM - edited Feb 14, 2019 10:23AM by pegasus68 I was told 3-5 business days for the result of my stereotactic biospy for 'new' but suspicious calcifications - which means I may not have answers for a week! So I'm right there waiting with you. Hugs and best wishes that all comes back normal for you! Incidentally, in an unrelated benign biopsy from the other breast last year, it looks like pathology report was completed in 2 days but I think my dr waited to call me until the radiologist had also looked at the pathology report and indicated that they agreed the pathology report was 'concordant' with what they saw on imaging (so it took me a week to get my results that time, too).
